dt: {bc}any of the abstract units of the {a_link|phonetic} system of a language that correspond to a set of similar speech sounds (such as the velar \k\ of {it}cool{/it} and the palatal \k\ of {it}keel{/it}) which are perceived to be a single distinctive sound in the language

et: borrowed from French {it}phonème,{/it} borrowed from Greek {it}phōnēmat-, phṓnēma{/it} "sound made by a person or animal, utterance, speech, language," from {it}phōnē-,{/it} variant stem of {it}phōnéō, phoneîn{/it} "to speak, utter, (of animals) make a sound, (of instruments) sound" (derivative of {it}phōnḗ{/it} "sound made by something living, voice, speech, utterance") + {it}-mat-, -ma,{/it} resultative noun suffix {ma}{mat|phono-|}{/ma}
shortdef: any of the abstract units of the phonetic system of a language that correspond to a set of similar speech sounds (such as the velar \k\ of cool and the palatal \k\ of keel) which are perceived to be a single distinctive sound in the language
